3.4.1.title: Surface Control Systems
3.4.1.content:
**Components:**
- Accumulator unit (bottles, pumps, manifold)
- Control panels (driller's panel, remote panels)
- Hydraulic control lines to BOP
- Regulators and valves

**Accumulator Unit:**
- Pre-charged bottles store hydraulic fluid under pressure
- Pumps maintain charge
- Provides rapid response independent of pumps
- Sized for required operations

**Control Panels:**
- Driller's panel at drill floor
- Remote panel away from wellbore
- Must be accessible in emergency
- Clear labeling of all controls

3.4.2.title: Subsea Control Systems
3.4.2.content:
**Multiplex (MUX) Systems:**
- Electrical signals control hydraulic valves at BOP
- Much faster than direct hydraulic
- Complex but reliable

**Dual Pod System:**
- Two identical control pods on LMRP
- Blue pod and Yellow pod
- Full redundancy - either can control all functions
- Switch between pods if one fails

**Control Lines:**
- MUX cables carry electrical signals
- Hydraulic supply lines
- Hot lines for critical functions
- Acoustic backup system

3.4.3.title: Accumulator Requirements
3.4.3.content:
**Capacity:**
Must have sufficient volume to:
- Close all BOPs
- Open one pipe ram
- Have reserve remaining
- All without pump assistance

**Calculation:**
Total required = Closing volumes + Opening volume + Reserve
Per API RP 53 requirements

**Pre-Charge:**
- Nitrogen pre-charge typically 1000-1200 psi
- Check pre-charge regularly
- Low pre-charge reduces effective volume

**Pressure:**
- System pressure typically 3000 psi
- Must overcome wellbore pressure plus friction
- Higher pressure systems for HPHT

3.4.4.title: Testing Control Systems
3.4.4.content:
**Response Time Test:**
- Measure time from activation to BOP function complete
- Surface: Annular < 30 seconds, Rams < 30 seconds typical
- Subsea: Longer due to distance

**Accumulator Test:**
- Operate all preventers on accumulator only (pumps off)
- Verify capacity meets requirements
- Check remaining pressure after operations

**Panel Function Test:**
- Verify all controls operate correct functions
- Test both panels (driller's and remote)
- Check indicators and alarms

**Documentation:**
- Record all test results
- Note times and pressures
- Track trends over time

3.4.5.title: Backup Systems
3.4.5.content:
**Surface Backup:**
- Remote panel provides backup location
- Manual locks on rams
- Dedicated accumulator bank may be available

**Subsea Backup:**
- Dual pods (switch if one fails)
- Acoustic control system
- ROV intervention capability
- Autoshear and deadman automatic activation

**Acoustic System:**
- Independent backup for critical functions
- Activated from surface by acoustic signal
- Can close shear rams and disconnect
- Test periodically

**ROV Intervention:**
- ROV can operate BOP functions via intervention panels
- Slower but provides ultimate backup
- Critical for lost communication scenarios
